results.title: Safety. Part 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Five ten minute programs demonstrate many unsafe and dangerous situations involving children and how to create a safe environment both inside and outside the home.

results.title: More questions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
In this title, viewers questions cover the topics of road safety, appropriate medications, how to handle dummies, the importance of immunisation, the dangers of smoking, and Government allowances for families. PGR also gives some tips for parents whose babies have been fitted with splints. We talk to a Speech Pathologist about childhood stuttering and demonstrate suitable exercises for women recovering from a caesarean. Finally, PGR answers questions specifically concerning SIDS, and we talk to parents about the syndrome.

results.title: Children and abuse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
There are four different categories of child abuse: Neglect, Emotional Abuse, Physical Abuse and Sexual Abuse. Through parents relating personal stories of their children and their experiences with child abuse P.G.R discusses the ease of damage to young children through any of the defined forms of abuse. Ways to create a positive emotional environment for the child, how to handle potential child abuse situations, and the value of “special time” are all discussed with parents.

results.title: Children and the Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
This title explores some of the arts available to children as both participants and observers. Theatre, art and music are discussed by performers and parents. Producers and parents give their views on children’s radio and television and, finally, a parent explains the value and the process of parents telling stories to their children.

results.title: Health Hints
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR looks at the First Aid kit, and what extra items are required when there are children in the house. We also show what to do in the event of a nose bleed or a tooth being knocked out. How childhood asthma affects children and their parents is also examined, with the support of the Asthma Foundation. Paula talks with a vet about the value of pets to children, and they discuss proper pet care procedures. Colin looks at the effects of poor co-ordination on young children, what parents need to watch for, and how training programs for clumsy children can make a big difference to their lives. It also includes an easy to remember guide on how to react to all first aid situations.

results.title: Early Learning
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR discusses the question: who is the child’s first educator?, and we talk with parents about their role as educators. The role of kindergartens is examined, and we demonstrate how to encourage a love of learning. We look at the importance of language in the learning process, at various aspects of early speech acquisition, and provide tips on the encouragement of a child to develop language skills. PGR also examines the role books and music can play in a child’s early learning development, and we examine the social aspect of developing learning skills.

results.title: Questions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
The PGR team answers specific questions sent in by viewers from all over Australia. Subjects covered include sleep problems, teaching young children different languages, expressing and storing breast milk, nutritional problems and health matters, such as trimming babies’ nails., appropriate sun protection, circumcision, flat feet and weak ankles. We also offer tips for concerned parents of adopted children, compare different methods of introducing the alphabet to pre-schoolers, and discuss what is “normal” behaviour in young boys.

results.title: Eating
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Eating introduces the basics of good nutrition. We talk to parents about what their children eat and provide examples of good food diets.

results.title: Books and Stories
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Discusses the importance of reading to children, and provides hints on how to choose books, and how and where to buy or borrow.

results.title: Suddenly you're a parent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Looks at the birth of a baby, examines the new born’s reflex abilities, and discusses the importance of movement and touch. The premature birth is also discussed.
